item.title: Picto Color releases iCorrect Portrait Photoshop plugin
item.description:
Picto Color releases iCorrect Portrait Photoshop plugin

We always liked the iCorrect plugins. iCorrect Portrait is a variation of the iCorrect Professional plugin that aims especially at the portrait and wedding photographers. The key concept are so called memory colors that can be defined by the user.

item.title: Photographers Becoming Security Concerns (Source npr.org)
item.description:
Photographers Becoming Security Concerns (Source npr.org)

Not only copyright law (e.g. landscape items being copyrighted) haunts photographers. Industrial photography even from public places can be seen to be a security issue.

item.title: Kodak to end production of black & white paper (Source DPReview)
item.description:
Kodak to end production of black & white paper (Source DPReview)

This is bad news for some. On the other side B&W printing from inkjet printers gets better by the day. The missing part for high quality B&W inkjet prints are now some top papers that do not show the plastic RC look. Matte papers are very nice too but they lack the gamut of classic fiber based papers.
item.author: Digital Outback Photo

item.title: Photoshop CS2: Where's My Stuff (by Ben Willmore)
item.description:
Photoshop CS2: Where's My Stuff (by Ben Willmore)

With every version of Photoshop some things may get organized in a different way. This is especially true for PS CS2. Ben provides a free document that shows where to find your old friends. This is a section from his latest book "Photoshop CS2 UpToSpeed".
item.author: Digital Outback Photo

item.title: Microsoft post RAW thumbnailer and viewer (Source DPReview)
item.description:
Microsoft post RAW thumbnailer and viewer (Source DPReview)

We failed to install as we do not have Service Pack 2 installed. Save your time if you do not have SP2 installed.

Further details on Microsoft's RAW File Support! (Source Imaging Resource)

If we do not miss anything here we cannot get that much excited about the Windows RAW support. We feel it maybe kind of nice but of no major consequences for a high-end RAW workflow.

item.title: Ben's PS Tips #2: RAW Files embedded in Photoshop Smart Objects
item.description:
Ben's PS Tips #2: RAW Files embedded in Photoshop Smart Objects

Smart Objects are new in Photoshop CS2. They allow you to embed RAW files into your layer stack and even change the settings for Camera Raw 3.x later.

item.title: Nikon D2X review by Phil Askey (DPReview)
item.description:
Nikon D2X review by Phil Askey (DPReview)

From Phil's conclusion: "...It's fair to say that with the D2X Nikon are well and truly 'back', a killer combination of the superb D2 body, a high resolution CMOS sensor and the added bonus of high speed shooting when you need it. What can I say? The ratio of Pros to Cons really sums up my whole feeling for the D2X, it's exactly what we expect Nikon to produce, a solid robust high performance digital SLR with superb image quality, build quality and a confidence inspiring sense of presence. ..". From our own tests with the D2X we are not surprised by Phils's excpetional rating.

If now Nikon would also stop encrypting their WB settings (read Michael Reichmann's article "The RAW Flaw").

item.title: RawShooter 1.1.3 released
item.description:
RawShooter 1.1.3 released

The main new features are improved copying of settings (via Ctrl+c/v) and a preview cache that allows faster comparison of 2-4 images (depends on the preference settings). The speed of preview generation was improved as well as bug fixes and other improvements.
item.author: Digital Outback Photo

item.title: Qimage v2005.300 released
item.description:
Qimage v2005.300 released

From the press release: "This latest edition of our popular batch image printing and processing software includes an all new folder browser with full network compatibility for accessing and managing images across a network using "My Network Places". We have also improved the visual interface substantially by redoing all tool buttons using brand new full color icons for a cleaner look that improves usability.

item.title: "The RAW Flaw" by Michael Reichmann and Juegen Specht
item.description:
"The RAW Flaw" by Michael Reichmann and Juegen Specht

This is a petition to open up raw file documentation of adopt a universal raw file standard format. Digital Outback Photo is in full support of OpenRAW and this additional initiative. A must read by all RAW users.

item.title: Our latest E-Book: The Art of RAW Conversion 2005
item.description:
Our latest E-Book: The Art of RAW Conversion 2005

We are proud to present our latest e-book on RAW workflow:

  • Our latest and most complete E-Book about RAW conversion
  • Photoshop CS2 Camera Raw 3.x
  • Pixmantec RawShooter, Phase One Capture One, Canon DPP, Nikon Capture, Bibble 4.x
  • Understanding the full RAW workflow
  • Introduction to DNG
  • Understanding basic color management
  • Converting to B&W with your RAW converters
  • Perfecting images by removing image artifacts like: Noise, Chromatic Aberrations, Lens Distortions, dust and sharpening
  • Upsizing, dark/light halo and edge mask sharpening
  • Based on real-world experience
  • Optimized for working on the screen

    You can upgrade from DOP2000 for only 27.95
item.author: Digital Outback Photo
